title: Content Syndication & Downloads
description: Add RSS feed for content syndication and resume download functionality

features.title: RSS Feed Generation
features.description: Generate RSS 2.0 feed for blog content syndication

stories.title: Create RSS feed generator
stories.description: Build script to generate RSS 2.0 XML feed from published posts
acceptance_criteria: Script generates valid RSS 2.0 XML at /feed.xml
Includes all published posts sorted by date (most recent first)
Each item has title, link, description (excerpt), pubDate, guid, author
Channel metadata includes blog title, description, link, language (en-us)
Feed validates against RSS 2.0 specification
Generates at build time (no runtime generation)
Feed limited to 50 most recent posts for size optimization
stories.technical_notes: Create lib/rss.ts with generateRSSFeed() function, add to build process or create route handler at app/feed.xml/route.ts

stories.title: Add RSS feed discovery links
stories.description: Add RSS feed auto-discovery link tags and visible subscribe button
acceptance_criteria: RSS auto-discovery link tag in <head> of all pages
RSS subscribe button in footer with icon
Button links to /feed.xml with appropriate ARIA label
Neo-brutalist button styling consistent with design system
Tooltip or label explaining RSS feed functionality
stories.technical_notes: Add to app/layout.tsx metadata and Footer component

features.title: Resume Download
features.description: Enable resume download from About page

stories.title: Create resume PDF export
stories.description: Generate or create downloadable PDF version of resume
acceptance_criteria: PDF file exists at /public/dakota-smith-resume.pdf
PDF includes all content from About page (experience, skills, certifications)
Professional formatting with consistent typography and spacing
File size < 500KB for fast download
PDF metadata includes author name and title
stories.technical_notes: Can be static PDF created manually or generated from About page content using a PDF generation library (puppeteer, react-pdf). Static is simpler for MVP.

stories.title: Add download button to About page
stories.description: Enable the disabled 'Download Resume' button on About page
acceptance_criteria: Download Resume button is active (not disabled)
Button downloads PDF file when clicked
Download attribute sets filename to 'Dakota-Smith-Resume.pdf'
Button has proper ARIA label for accessibility
Loading or success state feedback after click
Works across all major browsers and mobile devices
stories.technical_notes: Simple anchor tag with href='/dakota-smith-resume.pdf' and download attribute

success_criteria: RSS feed validates against RSS 2.0 specification
RSS feed accessible at /feed.xml and auto-discoverable
Resume downloads successfully from About page
notes: RSS feed should be static generation. Resume can be static PDF for MVP (manual creation acceptable).
